decision_conditions: The proposal, due to insufficient evidence by lack of a daylight and sunlight assessment has been submitted to determine if the reduction in the number of rooflights to the kitchen/living roof in Flat 5 would result in an experienced loss of daylight for future occupants and due to the removal of obscure glazing on the ground floor single-bedroom rear windows resulting in a loss of privacy for future occupants, would materially diminish the standard of accommodation of the approved development, contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM13 in Council's Core Strategy 2012.

The proposal, due to the removal of obscure glazing on the ground floor single-bedroom rear windows, would materially diminish the amenity of neighbouring occupants at no. 156B Clarence Avenue beyond the standard of the approved development in terms of loss of privacy, contrary to Paragraph 135 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023, Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM10 in Council's Core Strategy 2012.
description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Conditions 1 (Approved Plans) and 3 (Facing Materials) of planning permission 23/01699/FUL (Erection of a three storey residential building housing 5nos. new dwellings with associated cycle and bin access) to reduce the number of rooflights and change the rear window sizes and level of obscure glazing.
